title: Stadio Artemio Franchi – Montepaschi Arena
text:
Stadio Artemio Franchi is a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in <a href="Siena">Siena</a>, <a href="Italy">Italy</a>. It is currently used mostly for <a href="Association%20football">football</a> matches and the home of <a href="A.C.N.%20Siena%201904">A.C.N. Siena</a>. It was built in 1923 and holds 15,373.
It is named after former <a href="Italian%20Football%20Federation">Italian Football Federation</a> president <a href="Artemio%20Franchi">Artemio Franchi</a>.
In summer 2007, A.C. Siena agreed to rename the stadium '"Stadio Artemio Franchi – Montepaschi Arena"', to include the name of their main sponsor, <a href="Banca%20Monte%20dei%20Paschi%20di%20Siena">Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena</a>.
The stadium hosted its first and so far only international match on 17 October 2010, a 2–0 <a href="Exhibition%20game%23International%20football">friendly</a> win for <a href="Italy%20national%20football%20team">Italy</a> over <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20football%20team">South Africa</a>.
During March 2011, A.C. Siena announced plans to build a new stadium on the southern outskirts of the city at Isola d'Arbia. The new stadium, with a capacity of 20,000, features a revolutionary below-ground design which was honoured with an <a href="MIPIM%20AR%20Future%20Projects%20Award">MIPIM AR Future Projects Award</a>.
